lines.text: What's the heading?
Speed?
16, slowing. 15. 14.
What's the depth?
Thousand fifty. Fifty-five.
We're gonna run out of ocean.
You know Lieutenant Scott.
[Nicholson and Scott acknowledge one another]
This is the Master at Arms, Russ Bogan.
Lieutenant.
Russ here is Chief of the Boat, the COB.
That means I'm in charge of the bomb.
He also happens to be a charter member of the first underwater demolition team. The original frogman. He can help you handle the explosives.
I need help right now, sir. I'm assigned as Weapons Officer, which means I know which page to look up in Knight's Modern Seamanship, and that's all.
We can't move the boat. Move the rocks.
Those rocks must weigh more than a thousand tons.
We'll set up a series of charges, enough to gouge out the load. All we need is a couple of inches.
How do you know the charges won't crack us open?
Well, I don't. But if we sit here we're dead.
If the divers go out there, they're dead.
Not necessarily. We've had divers out at a thousand feet before. We got deep water rigs, exotic air mixtures, helium, argon. And we're loaded with experts.
Russ, that current's blowing at more than 12 knots. It can rip off tanks, face masks. It'll sweep those guys around like pieces of kelp.
We'll rig the gear with extra belts; hook up harnesses, cables to keep from being swept away. It's gotta be done.
Who's gonna do it?
Me.
You?
What do you mean, "you?" I got more time in a wetsuit than this whole group.
Yeah, that was a lot of hash marks ago.
Thanks a lot.
Well, you don't bail out at over a thousand every day.
Today's the day.

This goes for the memory of those that have died, for us. I am the resurrection, and the life, sayeth the Lord. And he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live. And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Amen.
